title: IELTS Academic Speaking Test
instructions: The Speaking test consists of 3 parts and takes 11-14 minutes. You will be assessed on fluency, vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.

parts.title: Part 1: Introduction and Interview
parts.description: The examiner will ask you questions about yourself and familiar topics.

questions: Where are you from?
What do you like most about your hometown?
Has your hometown changed much over the years?
What would you recommend visitors see in your hometown?
Do you work or are you a student?
What do you do for work/What are you studying?
Do you enjoy your job/studies?
What are your future career plans?
What do you like to do in your free time?
How long have you been interested in this hobby?
Do you prefer indoor or outdoor activities?
Have you made any friends through your hobbies?

parts.title: Part 2: Individual Long Turn
parts.description: You will be given a topic card and have 1 minute to prepare. You must speak for 1-2 minutes.

topics.topic: Describe a memorable journey you have taken
topics.card:
Describe a memorable journey you have taken.

You should say:
- where you went
- when you went there
- who you went with
- what you did there
- and explain why this journey was memorable for you

You have one minute to prepare your answer. You can make notes if you wish.

topics.topic: Describe a person who has influenced you
topics.card:
Describe a person who has influenced you in your life.

You should say:
- who this person is
- how you know this person
- what this person has done
- and explain how this person has influenced you

You have one minute to prepare your answer. You can make notes if you wish.

topics.topic: Describe a book you have read
topics.card:
Describe a book you have read that you found interesting.

You should say:
- what the book is about
- when you read it
- why you chose to read it
- and explain why you found it interesting

You have one minute to prepare your answer. You can make notes if you wish.

parts.title: Part 3: Two-way Discussion
parts.description: The examiner will ask you questions related to the topic in Part 2, but more abstract and complex.

questions: How has tourism changed in your country over the past decade?
What are the benefits and drawbacks of tourism for local communities?
Do you think virtual reality could replace actual travel in the future?
How important is it for people to travel to different countries?
How has education changed in your country in recent years?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of online learning?
Do you think traditional classroom learning will become obsolete?
How important is it for students to learn practical skills alongside academic subjects?
How has technology changed the way people communicate?
What are the positive and negative effects of social media on society?
Do you think artificial intelligence will replace human workers in the future?
How important is it for governments to regulate technology companies?

fluencyCoherence.description: Speak at length without hesitation, organize ideas logically

bandDescriptors.9: Speaks fluently with only rare repetition or self-correction
bandDescriptors.8: Speaks fluently with only occasional repetition or self-correction
bandDescriptors.7: Speaks at length with some hesitation and repetition
bandDescriptors.6: Speaks at length with noticeable hesitation and repetition

lexicalResource.description: Use vocabulary flexibly and precisely, demonstrate range

bandDescriptors.9: Uses vocabulary with full flexibility and precision
bandDescriptors.7: Uses vocabulary with some flexibility and precision
bandDescriptors.6: Uses vocabulary with limited flexibility and precision

grammaticalRange.description: Use a variety of sentence structures accurately

bandDescriptors.9: Uses a full range of structures with full flexibility and accuracy
bandDescriptors.8: Uses a wide range of structures with flexibility and accuracy
bandDescriptors.7: Uses a range of structures with some flexibility and accuracy
bandDescriptors.6: Uses a mix of simple and complex structures with some accuracy

pronunciation.description: Produce clear speech with appropriate stress and intonation

bandDescriptors.9: Uses pronunciation features with full flexibility and precision
bandDescriptors.8: Uses pronunciation features with flexibility and precision
bandDescriptors.7: Uses pronunciation features with some flexibility and precision
bandDescriptors.6: Uses pronunciation features with limited flexibility and precision
